main event: The report describes an object seen on multiple occasions since September 1953, with the most recent sighting on one April. The object is a light with relatively smooth edges, circular shaped, deep orange most of the time, but goes through color changing cycles occasionally. It moves in short straight lines, appears to gain and lose altitude, and eventually moves westward until out of sight.
interesting points: The object was seen on six or eight different occasions since September 1953
It goes through color changing cycles occasionally, changing from orange to pale blue to white then back to orange within approximately two seconds
The observers are preparing to obtain azimuth and elevation plots on the object upon its next appearance
The object is always visible for one to two hours and was viewed between 2040Z and 0400Z on one April
Local astronomers are involved in attempting to determine altitude, track, and velocity of the object
sighted object: circular shaped, deep orange light with color changing cycles
witnesses: Internal Revenue Department collector and reporter for Columbus Enquirer newspaper
